data.enText: to hit sb/sth with the flat part of your hand

data.chText: 她狠狠给了他一个耳光。
data.enText: She slapped his face hard.

data.chText: 她狠狠给了他一个耳光。
data.enText: She slapped him hard across the face.
‘Congratulations!’ he said, slapping me on the back.

data.chText: （尤指生气地）啪的一声放下，随意扔放
data.enText: to put sth on a surface in a quick, careless and often noisy way, especially because you are angry

data.chText: 他啪的一声把报纸摔在桌上。
data.enText: He slapped the newspaper down on the desk.

data.chText: 她啪地把一张10元钞票放在我手里。
data.enText: She slapped a $10 bill into my hand.
to hit against sth with the noise of sb being slapped
The water slapped against the side of the boat.
slap sb about/around
to hit sb regularly or often

data.chText: 她的前夫过去动不动就打她。
data.enText: Her ex-husband used to slap her around.
slap sb/sth↔down
to criticize sb in an unfair way, often in public, so that they feel embarrassed or less confident
slap sth on sb/sth
to order, especially in a sudden or an unfair way, that sth must happen or sb must do sth

data.chText: 公司对员工使用电子邮件发出禁令。
data.enText: The company slapped a ban on using email on the staff.
slap sth on sth
to increase the price of sth suddenly

data.chText: 他们把一包香烟的价格一下子提高了50便士。
data.enText: They've slapped 50p on the price of a pack of cigarettes.
slap sth on sth
slap sth↔on
to spread sth on a surface in a quick, careless way

data.chText: 在墙上随便刷点漆，就看着漂亮了。
data.enText: Just slap some paint on the walls and it'll look fine.

data.chText: 我出门以前最好是简单化化妆。
data.enText: I'd better slap some make-up on before I go out.
the action of hitting sb/sth with the flat part of your hand
She gave him a slap across the face.

data.chText: 他热情地在我背上拍了一下。
data.enText: He gave me a hearty slap on the back.

data.chText: 拍打声；类似拍打的声音
data.enText: the noise made by hitting sb/sth with the flat part of your hand; a similar noise made by sth else
the gentle slap of water against the shore
slap and tickle
enthusiastic kissing and cuddling between lovers
a slap in the face
an action that seems to be intended as a deliberate insult to sb
a slap on the wrist
a warning or mild punishment
slap bang
straight, and with great force

data.chText: 她怒气冲冲地冲出房间，迎面和卢克撞了个满怀。
data.enText: Storming out of her room, she went slap into Luke.
exactly

data.chText: 他们住的公寓恰巧在全城的中心。
data.enText: Their apartment is slap bang in the middle of town.

tr: a blow delivered with an open hand
a blow from a flat object (as an open hand)
hit with something flat, like a paddle or the open hand
example: The impatient teacher slapped the student
a gunshot slapped him on the forehead
he ran bang into the pole

value.def: If you slap someone, you hit them with the palm of your hand.

example.ex: He would push or slap her once in a while...
example.tran: 他偶尔会推搡她或是打她的耳光。

example.ex: I slapped him hard across the face...
example.tran: 我重重地掴了他一记耳光。

example.ex: He was slapping a woman around and I objected.
example.tran: 他正在掌掴一个女人，我上前制止。

example.ex: He reached forward and gave her a slap.
example.tran: 他上前打了她一个耳光。

value.def: If you slap someone on the back, you hit them in a friendly manner on their back.

example.ex: A large middle-aged lady slapped me on the back and said 'Nice to see you again.'
example.tran: 一位身材高大的中年女士拍了拍我的后背说：“很高兴再次见到你。”

value.def: If you slap something onto a surface, you put it there quickly, roughly, or carelessly.

example.ex: The barman slapped the cup on to the waiting saucer.
example.tran: 酒吧服务生麻利地把茶杯放在了茶碟上。

value.def: If journalists say that the authorities slap something such as a tax or a ban on something, they think it is unreasonable or put on without careful thought.

example.ex: The government slapped a ban on the export of unprocessed logs...
example.tran: 政府贸然禁止出口未加工过的原木。

example.ex: Thankfully the Government still hasn't discovered a way of slapping a tax on love, sunshine or air.
example.tran: 谢天谢地，政府还没有找到对爱情、阳光和空气课税的方法。

value.tran: (不合理或草率地)施加(赋税、禁令等)

value.def: If you describe something that someone does as a slap in the face, you mean that it shocks or upsets you because it shows that they do not support you or respect you.

example.ex: 'The Sun' calls it a massive slap in the face for the United States government...
example.tran: 《太阳报》称之为打在美国政府脸上的一记重重的耳光。

example.ex: Britons persist in treating any pay rise of less than 5% as a slap in the face.
example.tran: 英国人坚持认为加薪不到 5%不啻于一种羞辱。

value.def: A slap on the wrist is a warning or a punishment that is not very severe.

example.ex: The fine they gave her is just more or less a slap on the wrist.
example.tran: 他们对她开出的罚金不过是一个轻微的警告而已。

value.tran: 轻微的警告;轻微的惩罚

trans: 女子大乱斗；大乱斗；少妇大乱斗；恶女杀狠大
